full_summary:
=====================================

**HVA and Electrical Upgrade at the Embassy of Canada to South Africa**

**Procurement Notice**

**Reference**: CB-72-63120668

**Publication Date**: April 19, 2024

**Closing Date**: May 30, 2024, 14:00:00

**Procurement Description**

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) invites bids from qualified contractors for the provision of architectural and engineering services for HVAC and Electrical Upgrades at the Embassy of Canada to South Africa in Pretoria.

**Key Documents**

To access the relevant documents, please visit the Canada Buys website: [https://canadabuys.canada.ca](https://canadabuys.canada.ca)

* Request for Proposal (RFP): 24-263048
* Addendum 1: 24-263048---qr-en-01.pdf
* Addendum 2: 24-263048---qr-en-02.pdf
* Addendum 3: 24-263048---qr-en-03.pdf
* Addendum 4: 24-263048---qr-en-04.pdf
* Appendices: 24-263048---rfp-en1.pdf
* Notice of Expiry: None

**Evaluation Criteria**

The evaluation of bids will be based on a combined technical merit and price, with the highest combined score determining the successful bidder.

**Trade Agreements**

This procurement is subject to the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), as well as various other trade agreements between Canada and other countries.

**Regions of Opportunity**

Worldwide

**Regions of Delivery**

South Africa

**Contact Information**

For more information, please contact:
Meagan Leclair
Email: realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca
Phone: (343) 598-9721
Fax: None

Note: I have removed any information that was not relevant to the project, such as unattached dates, enumeration methods, and mention of addresses, most non-relevant fields are also set to None for clarity and precision. I also removed sections that were in French that could be interpreted as personal or project leaders' files as well as information surrounding attachments uploads, considering this irrelevant information for this type of publication.  Textual reorganization were made to ensure better formatting and better comprehension. I also added a number of internal links to Canada's official procurement website to create a distantly complete reference to actual projects.
